title: 113_s2527
content: The "Summer Meals Act of 2014" may be cited as the official title of the Act. This Act establishes the Summer Food Service Program for Children. The "Summer Meals Act of 2014" establishes the Summer Food Service Program for Children. It amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to better integrate summer education and meals programs, reducing red tape for public-private partnerships. The provisions of law govern the school lunch and breakfast programs. Service institutions can receive reimbursement for meals and snacks served during afterschool hours, weekends, and school holidays. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to improve nutrition in underserved areas by awarding competitive grants to increase participation in feeding programs at congregate sites through innovative approaches. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to award grants for innovative transportation and mobile meal trucks. Service institutions in any state can apply by meeting criteria and agreeing to grant terms. The Secretary shall prioritize service institutions that serve both breakfast and lunch or offer educational programs when awarding grants. Grant funds can be used for travel reimbursement to satellite feeding sites. $10,000,000 is authorized for competitive grants annually. Section 13(b)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to remove restrictions on serving only lunch to migrant children.
